messages.message: A prospect mentioned during the Human Review process, there s only a Finish and Submit, when they would like to reject document(s) altogether. Either manually or potentially with a filter if some confidence scores are super low. So they would like a second button such as "Reject"

We don't formally have a Review rejection workflow today (Backlog ticket: https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-2946), but if they just need a way to remove these reviews from the main review queue & not send data downstream, they could use either Escalation Queues (https://docs.instabase.com/apps/review#reviewing-results) or have a process to delete the runs (https://docs.instabase.com/apps/run-and-deploy#deleting-app-runs) (possible manually, after a retention period , or through the API).
I didn t think about the Escalation Queue. That should do it for now  :slightly_smiling_face: Thanks

Relatedly, I've always thought it would be nice to have a "skip" action (and potentially we could add a skip tag/counter whenever the action occurs which could be helpful) -- at which point, we should then probably add a "ignore/include skipped" runs/documents in our metrics dashboard... and now this is becoming quite the can of worms :lil_nervous: :card_file_box:
